content.description: Sit start on Cinderella is Dead and work right to finish on Pins & Feathers.
Start on Blood and Fire but go right through gastons to meet up with the big jug and top out on Blood and Fire.
content.location: Rightmost chalked line in the Spirit Walker Cave.

content.description:
With great technical movement, cool holds, and a direct line, this is probably the best problem in the cave.

Start in the break down in the middle of the cave with a heel/toe cam out right.  Decipher the sequence straight out the middle of the cave past a small crimp.
content.protection: Pads/Spotter.  Be careful with the heel/toe it has injured more than one knee

content.description:
Ochre & Ash isn't quite as nice of a line as some of the other routes in the cave, but it's still a fun climb, and a worthwhile diversion if you're waiting for your knee to heal from trying P&F.

Start on P&F, but move right in the break to a good crimp.  Do a big cross to a kind of grainy crimp, then match next to it on the pockety crimp.  From here move into the undercling on B&F, and finish on the rest of that route.

Alternatively, instead of crossing to the crimp/pocket you could continue traversing the break to the start of Blood & Fire.  Probably about the same grade, or maybe a little bit easier?

Along with Glass Sloper, this is another decent problem on the back side of the Spirit Walker boulder. If it weren't for a super sharp crimp, this one would be a lot more fun.

Start on a big undercling block, grab the sharp crimp, then bump up to a good pinch around the bulge.
content.protection: Pads. Not a bad fall, but lots of rocks to cover
content.location: On the backside of the Spirit Walker boulder.  Instead of going into the cave, walk around the left side.  Lady Tremaine starts near where a second  boulder is leaning against the Spirit Walker boulder.

content.description:
A cool problem that climbs through some of that classic nearly texture-less quartzite.

Sit start with a good low undercling for the left, and a ledge for the right.  Squeeze your way straight up through a swath of quartzite so smooth you can just about see your reflection, and top out.
content.protection: 3-4 Pads?  Not tall, but a jumbled talus landing.
content.location: On the back side of the Spirit Walker boulder.  Instead of turning right and going to the cave, keep going up around the back side.

content.description: Start on Blood & Fire and go left to finish on Pins & Feathers. Great movement and holds. FA called this 10/11.
content.location: Right side of cave, starts on B&F start hold

content.description: Start matched on the low side pull on the left side of the roof. Work up through three hard moves to gain the crimp rail and find a way to get to the lip.
content.location: Left most sit start in the Spirit Walker Cave.

content.description:
At V10, this is the "easy" climb in the cave.

Start off of a small boulder on the right side of the cave, matched on a good crimp rail.  A couple of easier moves on decent holds leads you to a pair of pinches, and the crux drive-by to a jug.
content.protection: I did it with 2 1/2 pads and thought that was appropriate.
